ch.ecma.csta.binding

Class AlternateCall

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.ecma.csta.CastorObject
      • ch.ecma.csta.binding.AlternateCall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AlternateCall
extends ch.ecma.csta.CastorObject
implements java.io.Serializable
    Places an existing call on hold and then retrieves a previously held or alerting call at the same device. This service is also used to place an active call on hold and then connect to an alerting or queued call at the same device (that is, to answer a call-waiting call).

    The AlternateCall request has these parameters:

    AlternateCall Request Parameters
    heldCall Mandatory Held Connection.
    activeCall Mandatory Active Connection.

    CSTA Functional Requirements:

    1. The Alternate Call service should not be used to put an alerting call on hold and re-connect to another call that is on hold.
    2. This service is a multiple step service that is equivalent to the computing function issuing the HoldCall service for the activeCall ConnectionID and then issuing one of the following services:
      • a RetrieveCall service for the heldCall ConnectionID.
      • an AnswerCall service for the heldCall ConnectionID.
      • an AcceptCall service for the heldCall ConnectionID.
    3. Not Supported
    4. Not supported as it applies to bridging.

    Negative Acknowledgements:

    • operation:invalidDeviceID - Sent if the specified DeviceID for the held call or active call is not valid.
    • operation:invalidConnectionID - Sent if the specified ConnectionID is not valid. The call may have ended.
    • stateIncompatibility:invalidConnectionIDForActiveCall - Sent if the controlling DeviceID in the active call and held call is different.
    • stateIncompatibility:invalidConnectionState - Sent if the heldcall is not in the alerting, connected, held, or bridged state.
    • operation:securityViolation - Sent if the user was not authorized to control the specified device.
    • stateIncompatibility:noActiveCall - Sent if the activeCall to be put on hold is not currently active (in alerting state, for example) so it cannot be put on hold.
    • systemResourceAvailability:generic - Sent if the client attempted to add a seventh party (otherCall) to a call with six active parties.
    • systemResourceAvailability:resourceBusy - Sent if the user at the heldCall station is busy on a call or there is no idle appearance available. It is also possible that the switch is busy with another CSTA request.
    • stateIncompatibility:generic - Sent if the heldCall station user did not go off-hook within five seconds and is not capable of being forced off-hook.
    • subscribedResourceAvailability:outstandingReqLimitExceeded - Sent if the client attempted to put a third party (activeCall) on hold (two parties are on hold already) on an analog station.
    • operation:generic - Sent if a logic error occurred in the code.
    • unspecified - Sent if an implementation specific error occurred.
    Version:
    $Revision$ $Date$
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public ConnectionID getActiveCall()

        Returns:
        ConnectionID

      • getConnectionReservation

        public java.lang.Boolean getConnectionReservation()
        Returns the value of field 'connectionReservation'. The field 'connectionReservation' has the following description: Specifies that the media stream channel(s) associated with the call being placed on hold be reserved for reuse at a later time. Optional.

        The complete set of possible values is:

        • True - channel(s) is to be reserved.
        • False - channel(s) is not to be reserved (default).
        Returns:
        Boolean
